1.title: Anthony Bourdain
1.plot: Host Neil deGrasse Tyson interviews chef Anthony Bourdain; Sasheer Zamata, Guy Crosby and Yvette d'Entremont discuss the science of food as it relates to taste, cooking and climate change; Natalia Reagan tries one of the hottest sauces in the world.

2.title: Joe Rogan and the Science of Primitive Man
2.plot: Neil features his interview with UFC commentator and podcaster, Joe Rogan.

3.title: The Big Bang Theory's Simon Helberg & Bill Prady
3.plot: Neil discusses the portrayal of scientists in pop culture featuring his interview with The Big Bang's Theory Simon Helberg and Bill Prady.

4.title: Bill Nye
4.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson interviews Bill Nye and talks science communication, romance and the signature bow tie.

1.title: George Takei
1.plot: The topic is the popular science fiction show Star Trek (1966). Guests include George Takei, Charles Liu, Leighann Lord and Bill Nye.

2.title: Christopher Nolan
2.plot: Discussing how director Christopher Nolan translates his love of science to his films; with theoretical cosmologist Dr. Janna Levin and comic Eugene Mirman.

3.title: Dan Savage
3.plot: Activist, author and journalist Dan Savage joins Dr. Tyson to discuss what love means in today's society. Anthropologist Helen Fisher and comedian Chuck Nice add their insight to the conversation.

4.title: Arianna Huffington
4.plot: Dr. Neil deGrasse Tyson and Arianna Huffington, co-founder and editor-in-chief of The Huffington Post, explore Living in the Information Age. The two discuss how technology influences the rate and ways in which we communicate. Journalist Jeff Jarvis and comedian Chuck Nice add their insight.

5.title: Richard Dawkins
5.plot: StarTalk tackles a burning question: Can Science and Religion Coexist? Dr. Neil deGrasse Tyson and evolutionary biologist and ethologist Richard Dawkins debate whether science and religion can truly coexist in today's society. Jesuit clergyman James Martin and comedian Eugene Mirman weigh in.

6.title: Jimmy Carter
6.plot: Dr. Neil deGrasse Tyson and President Jimmy Carter examine the topic of Pulling the Plug on Pestilence. The duo discuss the importance of and progress toward ending fatal epidemic diseases. Mark Siddall, curator of the division of invertebrate zoology at the American Museum of Natural History, and comedian Chuck Nice share their views on this matter.

7.title: Chris Hadfield
7.plot: Social Media-Savvy Astronauts are taking over the cosmos. Dr. Neil deGrasse Tyson and Chris Hadfield, the first Canadian astronaut to walk in space, discuss social media milestones in space, and its usage among today's astronauts. Former astronaut Dr. Mike Massimo and comedian Eugene Mirman comment on this growing trend.

8.title: Biz Stone
8.plot: Dr. Tyson explores The Impact of Twitter on Society as he sits down with Biz Stone, co-founder of Twitter and co-founder/CEO of Super.me. The two discuss how the social media phenomenon has affected the way we communicate in today's world. Sharing their experience and opinions are Dr. Alondra Nelson, professor of sociology at Columbia University; Clive Thompson, journalist; and Eugene Mirman, comedian.

9.title: Charles Bolden
9.plot: This week's theme is NASA's Vision on Space. Dr. Neil deGrasse Tyson and Maj. Gen. Charles Bolden, administrator of NASA, examine NASA's past, present and future. Astrophysicist Dr. Michael Shara and science educator Bill Nye share their thoughts on the space program.

10.title: Norman Lear
10.plot: Dr. Neil deGrasse Tyson and Norman Lear, television writer and producer, discuss TV and the Evolution of American Culture. From "All in the Family" to "The Big Bang Theory," the diverse television landscape and evolving American culture are explored. Author Saul Austerlitz and comedian Chuck Nice add their insight.

1.title: Bill Clinton
1.plot: In the season premiere, Neil deGrasse Tyson sits down with former President Bill Clinton, who was a strong advocate of science education and advancement during his two presidential terms. President Clinton opens up about his deep appreciation for science as he delves into topics including the importance of science in politics, the cosmic perspective, the Human Genome Project and Einstein. At the Cullman Hall of the Universe, Tyson continues the conversation with his comedian co-host Chuck Nice and genomics expert Juan Enriquez. Meanwhile, Bill Nye gives his take on ...

2.title: Larry Wilmore
2.plot: Larry Wilmore joins Tyson in the hot seat as the two delve into the intersection of science and comedy. At the Cullman Hall of the Universe, Tyson is joined by his co-hosts: comedian Chuck Nice and Scott Weems, author of "Ha. The Science of When We Laugh and Why." The three discuss the physiology of laughter, the mathematics of crafting jokes and the link between humor and creativity. Adding to the discussion, author Andy Weir patches into the studio to discuss the comedy in his book "The Martian" and Bill Nye presents an improve performance to demonstrate that ...

3.title: Seth MacFarlane
3.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson joins Seth MacFarlane, creator of "Family Guy" and fellow executive producer of "Cosmos: A SpaceTime Odyssey", to discuss the role science plays in his work and personal life. In a private interview, the two take on myriad topics, including social issues in cartoons, the science of "Family Guy" and the science fiction parodies that abound in the series. Tyson is joined in the Cullman Hall of the Universe by comedian co-host Chuck Nice and astrophysicist and AMNH research associate Charles Liu, and later Bill Nye gives his take on cartoons and ...

4.title: Penn and Teller
4.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson interviews magicians Penn and Teller and discusses the science of illusion with co-host Chuck Nice and guest Susana Martinez-Conde.

5.title: Susan Sarandon
5.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson expands his cosmic perspective with actress and activist Susan Sarandon. The two discuss gender, race, perspective, marijuana and Carl Sagan.

6.title: David Byrne
6.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson interviews musician David Byrne and discusses creativity in the arts and sciences with co-host Maeve Higgins and guest Monica Lopez-Gonzalez.

7.title: Mars 1
7.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson interviews Mars One co-founder Bas Lansdorp and discusses the idea of establishing a permanent human settlement on Mars with co-host Eugene Mirman and guest Mike Massimino.

8.title: David Crosby
8.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson interviews David Crosby and discusses folk music and social justice with co-host Chuck Nice and guest Thomas Sugrue.

9.title: Brian Cox
9.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson interviews physicist Brian Cox and discusses communicating science to the public with co-host Maeve Higgins and guest Jason Silva.

10.title: Gina McCarthy
10.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson interviews Gina McCarthy and discusses the EPA's efforts in keeping the Earth habitable for humans with co-host Maeve Higgins and guest Andrew Revkin.

1.title: Whoopi Goldberg
1.plot: Legendary Academy Award-winning actress and comedian Whoopi Goldberg sits down with host Neil deGrasse Tyson to discuss a range of topics, from Star Trek: The Next Generation to superheroes to medical marijuana. Tyson is joined by comedian co-host Chuck Nice and guests Charles Liu, astrophysicist at the American Museum of Natural History, and Dr. Staci Gruber, associate professor of psychiatry at Harvard Medical School. Adding to the discussion, data journalist Mona Chalabi explains the U.S. budget for space exploration and Bill Nye gives his take on medical marijuana.

2.title: Mayim Bialik
2.plot: Host Neil deGrasse Tyson interviews "The Big Bang Theory" actress and neuroscientist Mayim Bialik. Tyson and Bialik discuss the portrayal of science on television by analyzing such topics as women in science, television characters as role models and using comedy to spark interest in science. In the Hall of the Universe, Tyson is joined by comedian co-host Chris Hardwick and guest Summer Ash.

3.title: Man on Wire
3.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson discusses the physics of high wire acts with Philippe Petit.

4.title: Time Travel
4.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson talks about the science and fantasy of time travel with Christopher Lloyd and Michelle Gomez

5.title: Theoretical Physics
5.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson interviews theoretical physicist Brian Green about the multiverse and the Matrix.

6.title: Robert Kirkman and the Walking Dead
6.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson interviews Robert Kirkman and talks about the sociological impacts of the zombie apocalypse.

7.title: Jeremy Irons
7.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson talks about mathematics, the language of the universe, featuring his interview with actor Jeremy Irons and director Matthew Brown from the film The Man Who Knew Infinity.

8.title: The Martian
8.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson discusses surviving on Mars including the physics and engineering that goes into landing on the surface of Mars and growing food on Mars, featuring his interview with author Andy Weir.

9.title: Ben Stiller
9.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson interviews Ben Stiller and uncovers Stiller's geek underbelly.

10.title: Buzz Aldrin
10.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson interviews Buzz Aldrin and talks about his trip to the moon and the legacy of the Apollo project.

11.title: Terry Crews
11.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson talks the science of diet and exercise featuring his interview with Terry Crews.

12.title: Jay Leno
12.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson talks about the science behind laughter and comedy with Jay Leno.

13.title: William Shatner
13.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson talks about the enduring nature of science fiction featuring his interview with William Shatner.

14.title: US Secretary of Defense Ash Carter
14.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson talks about the future of science and technology in the armed forces featuring his interview with Defense Secretary, Ash Carter.

15.title: Hope Solo
15.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson talks the science of sports featuring his interview with Hope Solo.

16.title: Search for Aliens
16.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson talks about the search for extraterrestrial intelligence featuring his interview with the SETI co-founder, Jill Tarter. Are they out there? Where are they? Are they listening?

17.title: The Science of Weather
17.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson talks about the science of weather and climate featuring his interview with Kathryn Sullivan, the current Under Secretary of Commerce for Oceans and Atmosphere and Administrator of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric.

18.title: Science of Game of Thrones
18.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson discusses the science behind Game of Thrones, and that of the dark and middle ages, featuring his interview with Isaac Wright.

19.title: Herbie Hancock and Wayne Shorter
19.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson talks about the art and science of jazz music featuring his interview with Herbie Hancock and Wayne Shorter.

20.title: Bill Maher
20.plot: Neil deGrasse Tyson discusses satire in society, politics in comedy and political correctness, featuring his interview with Bill Maher.

1.title: Lance Armstrong
1.plot: Neil talks the science of cycling featuring his interview with controversial cyclist Lance Armstrong.

2.title: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar
2.plot: Neil breaks down the science of basketball featuring his interview with all-time great Kareem Abdul-Jabbar.

3.title: Jane Goodall
3.plot: Neil talks about the amazing researcher, Jane Goodall, featuring his interview with her.

4.title: Katie Couric
4.plot: Neil talks about the intersection of science principals and journalism featuring his interview with renowned journalist, Katie Couric.

5.title: Kevin Smith
5.plot: Neil discusses the science behind science fiction and superheros, featuring his interview with Kevin Smith.

6.title: SciFi Meets National Defense
6.plot: Neil discusses the intersection of science fiction and national defense focusing on the secretive, government agency, DARPA, featuring his interview with its former head, Arati Prabhakar.

7.title: Katy Perry
7.plot: Neil features his interview with Katy Perry and talks about her obsession with extraterrestrials and answers her cosmic queries.

8.title: Sylvia Earle, Fabien Cousteau & Adrian Grenier
8.plot: Neil talks about the Earth's oceans featuring his interviews with Sylvia Earle and Fabien Cousteau.

9.title: James Cameron
9.plot: Neil discusses the intersection of storytelling, exploration and science featuring his interview with James Cameron.

10.title: Celestial Navigation
10.plot: Neil discusses the science of celestial navigation featuring his interview with Nainoa Thompson.

11.title: Salman Rushdie
11.plot: Neil discusses the science of storytelling featuring his interview with Salman Rushdie.

12.title: Interstellar Space Travel
12.plot: Neil discusses the challenges of interstellar travel with Godfrey and Lawrence Krauss, also featuring his interview with Mae Jemison.

13.title: Alan Alda
13.plot: Neil discusses science communications featuring his interview with Alan Alda.

14.title: Stephen Colbert
14.plot: Neil discusses the intersection of science and comedy, featuring his interview with Stephen Colbert.

15.title: True Story of Hidden Figures
15.plot: Neil discusses NASA's hidden figures featuring his interview with Margot Lee Shetterly and Janelle Monáe.

16.title: Sam Harris and the Science of Belief
16.plot: Neil discusses aspects of religion including free will featuring his interview with neuroscientist Sam Harris.

17.title: Frank Oz and the Science of Puppeteering
17.plot: Neil discusses the influence of puppets on pop culture featuring his interview with Frank Oz.

18.title: Kelly Slater and the Science of Surfing
18.plot: Neil talks the science of surfing featuring his interview with surfing champion, Kelly Slater.

19.title: Astronaut Scott Kelly
19.plot: Neil discusses the science of human space flight featuring his interview with astronaut Scott Kelly.

20.title: Stephen Hawking
20.plot: Host Neil deGrasse Tyson features his interview with world-renowned physicist and cosmologist Stephen Hawking. Tyson is joined in the Hall of the Universe by comedian co-host Matt Kirshen, along with theoretical physicists Janna Levin and Michio Kaku, to discuss some of the mysteries of our universe. Adding to the discussion, Bill Nye the Science Guy weighs in from the Griffith Observatory in Los Angeles.

-1.title: Sketchfest 2017
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

imdb.plot outline: Science meets pop culture on StarTalk! Astrophysicist and Hayden Planetarium director Neil deGrasse Tyson, his comic co-hosts, guest celebrities and scientists discuss astronomy, physics, and everything else about life in the universe.
imdb.title: StarTalk
plot: Famed astrophysicist Dr. Neil deGrasse Tyson discusses science and pop culture with notable guests.

Science meets pop culture on _StarTalk_ (qv)! Astrophysicist and Hayden Planetarium director Neil deGrasse Tyson, his comic co-hosts, guest celebrities and scientists discuss astronomy, physics, and everything else about life in the universe.::alan hamel
